VNS_desc: The design spaces in our corpus focus on three primary areas of visualization research: traditional visualization, narrative visualization, and tangible visualization.

Within these focus areas, we identify nine visualization techniques that are frequently addressed in design spaces. These techniques can be grouped into three categories: visuals, interaction, and narrative.

The construction process of developing a well-structured design space can be divided into six distinct phases: data collection, corpus refinement, design space construction, design space refinement, design space analysis, and design space evaluation.

Our analysis of the papers in our corpus reveals that these theoretical foundations originate from both the visualization domain and non-visualization domains, highlighting the interdisciplinary nature of visualization research.
Illustrations help depict and communicate the resulting design spaces.
